conclusion: Analyze effects of placing charges at vertices of equilateral triangle to determine electric field strength and potential at center.
Equilateral triangle with vertices A, B, and C; charges of equal magnitude and like sign at A and B; electric field strength at center O due to these charges is E.
Electric field at O due to single charge at A or B is directed away from charge if positive, towards if negative.
Electric fields at O from A and B add vectorially due to equal magnitude and like sign.
Symmetry implies electric field vectors from A and B at O have equal magnitude and are directed along lines joining O to A and O to B.
Resultant electric field at O due to charges at A and B is along line joining O to midpoint of AB.
Equal magnitude opposite sign charge placed at point C.
Electric field due to charge at C directed towards C if positive, away if negative.
Symmetry implies electric field due to charge at C cancels resultant electric field due to charges at A and B.
Net electric field at point O becomes zero.
Electric potential is scalar quantity, adds algebraically.
Potential at O due to single charge is V = k*q/r, where k is Coulomb's constant, q is charge, r is distance from charge to O.
Potential at O due to charges at A and B is sum of potentials due to each charge.
Opposite sign charge at C contributes negative potential at O.
Potential due to charge at C cancels sum of potentials due to charges at A and B due to equal magnitude.
Magnitude of electric field strength at O is 0; electric field vectors cancel out due to symmetry and opposite charge at C.
Electric potential at O is 0; potential contributions cancel out due to opposite sign charge at C.
